bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter fragment from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [January 1, 1901?]

div1.p: Reed writes that the yellow fever experiments have answered his prayers to do some good for mankind.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [January 1, 1901?]
div1.p:
pier- Notwithstanding this
a feeling of happiness,
hard to express in words,
comes over when I think
that Heaven has at
last answered my daily
-prayer;- that I might live
to do some good for human-
ity- At last my prayer
for it is a beautiful, bright,
perfect morning- Has Mr
Wild fixed your corners for
you yet? You see that I still
take an interest in your
welfare, lovie, dear- Be a good
little girl and make that other
sweet girl go to school every
day but Saturday & Sunday- Boo!
Boo! to you Miss Room-fixer-
Kisses & love for my sweet babies,
